column4: I am unable to ping/access a website on my linux box (i can't get its ip address resolved), all other websites work... on my other computer, I can visit the website though.. what could be wrong.. hosts file looks normal..
both pc's have the same ip
(router)
same external ip i mean
sounds like an DNS issue.  check the contents of  /etc/resolv.conf
trying deleting the first nameserver mentioned in /etc/resolv.conf so that the second one gets used
I can't ping the IP like I should
it does 1 ping, and fails... and then I have 100% packet loss
lots of firewalls [incorrectly]  drop ICMP ping packets.  Can you successfully ping /any/ sites?
yes, I can ping all other sites..
then I wouldn't worry.
just not this one I am having trouble with (www.beryl-project.org)
I'm not worrying, but I also can't access the website....
not with 2 different external IP's on this computer
www.beryl-project.org resolves to  195.14.0.203  for me, can you ping that IP directly?
I already tried that, I am talking to the admin of beryl-project.org on IRC.. didnt work, thats the thing that gave me: 55 packets transmitted, 0 received, 100% packet loss, time 54017ms
I suspect that www.beryl-project.org is served from many different servers, in a "round robin" fashion.  Perhaps the particular one you got given is currently down or doesn't accept ping packets
well it must be the first problem, because I can't access it either?
admin says its only 1 server
so, what happens in you  apt-get install mtr   and then  mtr www.beryl-project.org    how far do the packets get?
like... nothing...
actuallythe mtr program kinda stays blank/freezes for some time
and when i wait long enough: Temporary failure in name resolution: Success
...more ideas?
